Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic

Class LineByLineProcessor

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.LineByLineProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class LineByLineProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

This utility class supports line-by-line processing for the character streams. It parses the input stream data, defines line locations in it, calculates sequential number for the lines found and pass it to callback for longer processing

The main idea of this class is to reduce data moving when character stream is parsing. Line is any character sequence, terminated with '\n' char. Source data for this class is a lot of of character arrays are passing to the write method of the class. This class parse every character array, find all the lines in them, and sequentially send all the lines found to the callback for longer processing. If some line is located in more than one input piece of data, this class builds the line from all pieces and also send in to the callback. It's the only case when the class uses any data moving. In all other cases this class passes the source data directly to the callback. It's strongly recommended to use this class since Java 1.9, because string operations performance was sensitively reduced in it

Class logic guarantees, that all the lines are passing to the callback will be terminated with '\n' char, including the same last line in the source data. Char '\r' also can presents in the callback data as option

This class implements Closeable interface, so it can be used in the try-with-resource statements.

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
Writer, ILineByLineProcessorCallback, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

    • write

      public void write​(char[] cbuf, int off, int len) throws java.io.IOException, SyntaxException

      Process the next piece of source data. This method is similar to Writer.write(char[],int,int) method.

      Parameters:
      cbuf - char arrays containing source data
      off - offset inside the source array to use as data beginning
      len - length of data need to process
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any I/O exceptions were detected
      SyntaxException - if any syntax problems was detected
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any parameter's problems

    • write

      public void write​(java.io.Reader rdr) throws java.io.IOException, SyntaxException

      Process data from the reader until EOF will be detected

      Parameters:
      rdr - reader to process data from
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any I/O exceptions were detected
      SyntaxException - if any syntax problems were detected
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any parameter's problems

    • pushProcessing

      public void pushProcessing() throws java.io.IOException, SyntaxException

      Pushes processing on any state and save tail content for longer using. Can be used inside callback to switch source for this class

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - is any I/O errors were detected on this call
      SyntaxException - if any syntax errors were detected in this call
      Since:
      0.0.2
